intro: Peucedanum sativum, commonly known as cow parsley or parsley weed, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or greenish-yellow flowers. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia and thrives in moist, temperate climates. It often grows in meadows, along roadsides, and in disturbed soils. Its aromatic seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a spice in some cuisines.
